resources.string:
1. Walk with the entire soles of your boots touching the ground, to spread the load evenly across your feet.

 2. Free your hands or hold a walking stick to assist balance.

 3. Maintain a steady and natural pace, and one that suits you.

 4. Plan to end your hike two hours before sunset.

 5. Never drink untreated water from hill streams or eat any wild plants or mushrooms.

 6. Trim your toenails, and try to keep your feet clean and dry. Stop walking if your feet are uncomfortable. Inspect them and treat any wounds promptly.
Get more tips on AFCD\'s website
